Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Helstjames
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Castello offered us everything we wanted as accommodation for our stay in Venice. It is conveniently located on the quieter side of San Marco Square in an area of narrow streets and Venetian charm. There are plenty of restaurants nearby offering a choice of price and cuisine. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast is continental with everything needed for a good start to the day. Croissants are fresh and plentiful. The room was clean with a good sized bathroom, the beds were comfortable. There was no hot drink making facility but there was a mini-bar. Our room did not have a view but I guess that is to be expected for most rooms in Venice. All in all were were very comfortable with no complaints or criticism of the hotel. We would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, typically Venetian”
Reviews.Author: Darren C
Reviews.Content: Was really impressed with this hotel. Close to all the Major Venetian attractions, San Marco, Doges Palace and San Zaccaria. The room was small but comfortable with all ammenities (aircon, TV, Mini Bar). The Bathroom was well equipped and very neat. The staff were friendly and very helpful when asking how to get to meusems. The hotel also has free Wifi access in the lobby. I woud highly recomend this hotel if you are staying in Venice for a short vaction

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicoeugen
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend went here at the end of november 2011 and everything was just perfect starting the room, which was clean, confortably bed, lcd tv, seif and a minibar. bathroom was pretty big, clean, with everything in it (towels, soap, shampoo, hairdrier, etc). the hotel is located right in the heart of Vennice, 5 minutes from Saint Mark;s square, the breakfast was more then enough with cereals, milk, toast, ham, some sallamy, honey, butter, croissants, etc and coffee, hmmmmm, the incredible caffe latte served each morning.the smell of fresh croissant and coffee were inveding our room every morning. it was just wonderful. Vennice is incredible and the word are not enough to describe it. To bad about the big prices :) I will definitley go back to Vennice and to Castello hotel.

Reviews.Title: “week in venice”
Reviews.Author: bobsblues
Reviews.Content: Apon arrival there was a smell of drains in the entrance foyer ,breakfast was continental with not much selection of cereal or cold meats /cheese's.Room was small but this is the case in a lot of venice hotels .Bed wasn't that comfortable ,but the shower room although small was refurbished and good hot water supply.Location was good for us not far from st marks square.Wasn't to hard to find although it was up a little alley you have to keep looking up for the sign .Staff were friendly but be aware that there is a CITY TAX to pay and the end of your stay (This applies to all of venice),there was a notice on the notice board.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: zakaki
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Castello. The staff were friendly, the rooms were beautifully decorated and cleaned daily. We would certainly go again and would recommend a visit to the Castello centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: CCurtis_11
Reviews.Content: the hotel was a great deal and a great location just behind St. Mark's square. the rooms were small, decorated in the old venitian style, and quite location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Brendan R
Reviews.Content: The Castello has a great location five minutes from St. Mark's and the Riva degli Schiavoni and its several vaporetto stops. The rooms are on the small side, but adequate. Ours were very quiet. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ShainavG
Reviews.Content: This nice little hotel, just a stone's throw away from St. Marks square was a surprise package of our trip. It was relatively easy to find, cozy & cheap. The staff was extremely cordial and helpful. We had to catch train next morning at 7am and had to leave hotel at 5 in morning. The hotel arranged excellent breakfast for us at early in morning with juice cans. If you want to enjoy Venice, then it is highly recommendable to stay near St. Mark's square and with very expensive options around; Castello has been a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Elicia_31
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, relatively easy to find- afterall it is Venice! We triple shared in our room and it was a little small but we did not spend any time in the room so it was sufficient. The hotel is very venetian with thick red carpets and most of the staff were friendly. The beds were clean and the room tidy. The bathroom was nice and the shower had excellent water pressure. The breakfast was nice although when the food ran out they were slow to replace the food or just did not replace it at all. Overall a good hotel to stay in and reasonably priced in an overpriced city!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, you just have to find it......”
Reviews.Author: OzCru
Reviews.Content: Great location on Venice Island itself, an easy walk from Piazza San Marco and the major sights. Initially finding it was challenging, as the access street from the nearest vaporetto station was obscured and even when located was very narrow I.e. a single person alleyway. Our room was in the annex (Locando Correr) to the main hotel, which suited us - it was quieter and smaller, with a nice separate lounge room which we were able to use as our private dining room several evenings. The room itself was smallish but entirely adequate, decorated in best faux classical Venetian style. Breakfasts were basic continental, the same every day and not at all imaginative, but good enough to get the day started. Bathroom mould was a little worrying as was the extractor fan which had a life of its own. We didn't have much to do with the staff, but they seemed helpful. Note that if you're leaving before 8.00a.m. you need to forewarn the checkout staff the night before, as the night watchman has no change or credit card facilities. Our departure was enlivened somewhat by a lightning strike of all vaporetto operators, which meant no transport to the station ... But we were lucky to get the only water taxi in sight instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staf, spacious room but a not so good bed!”
Reviews.Author: Lilian C
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nigths at Hotel Castelo. Near from vaporeto San Zaccaria, but pay attention on which stop you take, maybe you have to cross a bridge with stairs before arrive to the hotel. The hotel has a strange entrance and no elevator but the breakfast is very good and the room that we've stayed was very spacious but the bed was terrible very unconfortable. You need to walk just a block for San Marco's Square and there are a lot of good restaurants and stores in the neigbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience!”
Reviews.Author: Car0line19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Loccanda correr for 3 nights which is affiliated to Hotel Castello, 20meters away. Perfect location, nice small but very clean room. The staff was nice and helpful. There is a nice patio on the roof where you can get away from the crowd and relax having an inexpensive bottle of wine from the hotel bar.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great staff, nice room!”
Reviews.Author: bernardo_t16
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, just a block from San Marco's Square, you won't have to worry about schedules and won't waste time and $ in water buses from and to your hotel everyday. Initially hard to find because its entrance is in an alley, once you're there it's a great experience. The staff is very helpful, on the night we got there, when we asked for a nearby good restaurant, the guy on the reception actually walked us two blocks to a fantastic italian sea food place. Our room was large, clean, very nice. Breakfast is very nice too. We were so satisfied that my father is going to Venice in two weeks and will stay there. We'll surely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mdwebb
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this Hotel in a quad room. We arrived early to Venice and the hotel was very easy to find from the water taxi stop. We left our luggage and came back to check in after 1pm. Quad room had 1 double bed and one double pull out. Not tons of room, but plenty for the amount of time we spent in the room. Bathroom was very nice. Hotel located in Castello which was just a short walk to St Mark's Square. Free WiFi in lobby. Very quiet location and several great resturants on the same street. Breakfast was included in fare and included yogurt, cereal and I am sure a couple of other items, but this seems to be what I had and remember. Great hotel and convienent location.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional hotel thats great for its location”
Reviews.Author: stevejb4u
Reviews.Content: Chose the hotel for its location mainly as was the next street/canal from St Marks Square. A bit hard to find at first ( hidden down a small alley way ) but once found the hotel it was fine. Upon arrival you were clearly in a typical venetian styled hotel with its decor and furniture. The reception staff were freindly and helpfull and we were shown to our room. Although a little on the small size it was ok, again traditonal decor & furniture. It was great to hear the bells of St Marks in a morning and even from the roof top terrace you could see St Marks bell tower towering over the venetian rooftops. Breakfast was ok nothing special but continental breakfast never are, plenty to choose from but it was all cold buffet though nothing hot. No fruit was available though which was suprising just the juices to drink with your breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: KimPearce
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Castello for 5 nights at the end of May and found it to be a lovely hotel with friendly staff. Our room was nicely furnished, with free air conditioning and tv. It had a new bathroom suite with loo, bidet, shower etc. It was cleaned daily and kept spotless. Hotel is in great location, a few minutes from St Marks Square, and a few steps away from bars and restuarants. Plenty of choice for breakfast, cereals, ham, cheeze, youghurts, juices, etc. All the staff we met spoke english and put up with our attempts to speak italian. We would certainly go back and stay here. No real tips for Venioce itself, other than expect to pay over the odds for everything. If you take a trip to Burano and want some food, try the Pizzeria Bar Sport, not a brillient name but sit outside in the sunshine and enjoy some excellent food. It is located at the end of the Via B. Galuppl, and to the right. We did have a pizza which was the best we had, but the treat for me was the scallops in brandy served in their shells, which were delicious, and served very decorativly on a bed of coloured salt.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: carolspooner
Reviews.Content: Have recently stayed at The Hotel Castello for 3 nights. The location couldn't have been better about 5 minutes from San Zaccaria. Directions from the hotel could have been better. The room was sufficient for our stay. There was a good choice for breakfast. We bought a 3 day pass for 33 euros which was well worth it. Just one complaint. I had some costume jewellery stolen which was in a jewellery wrap hidden under t shirts in a drawer. When i went to report this which was about an hour before we were leaving having only just realised it was missing the man at reception decided he didn't understand english, which he had been speaking very well during our stay. He then told us to go to the police which for one wouldn't have been worth it and we didn't have the time. So a word of warning

Reviews.Title: “It is brilliant”
Reviews.Author: janchase
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 days in Venice and stayed at the Costello Hotel. It was in a great location, a couple of minutes walk from St. Mark's Square. The staff were very helpful and friendly, expecially Christoph. The rooms were comfortable, especially the beds. We would have no hestiation in recommending anyone to stay at the hotel if they are going to Venice. We had a wonderful time

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel, fabulous location great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: suemorris116
Reviews.Content: we booked this last minute and were not expecting a great deal and i must admit when you see these little hotels in the backstreets you wonder what you are doing, however, it was like a tardis. Staff helpful, rooms small ( as in all of italy) but clean and the breakfast was delicious, fresh croissants and rolls and the location is brilliant. Just a short walk from the waterbus and right near to st marks square. We were glad we didn't buy a 3day waterbus pass, we didn't need it. Venice is REALLY expensive so try and check the prices everywhere beforehand. On the last night we found the bar Aciughete which was a few yards from the hotel and it was the best place around. I didn't realise till we were home that it was in the quide book! This is not a five star hotel so do not expect to pay these great value prices and then moan. The bathroom was spotless. If you go with an open mind it is a really great base to seeVenice

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small, clean hotel but could do better”
Reviews.Author: xyzn
Reviews.Content: A 5 minutes walk from San Zaccaria vaporetto stop. Turned into a small (smelly) alley for the entrance. Once you get inside it was quite cozy. Our room was not finished by the time we arrived which was 2 hours past check in time. Quite troublesome as we needed to leave some of our stuff from the hand luggage, go to the bathroom and pray before going to the Dodge Palace. Well, we made do by repacking right in front of the concierge which is just in front of the dining place and used their bathroom nearby. After we came back that later (tired and spent after walking trying to find halal food) we came to a very small (common I think), cozy, very clean room. Interestingly the bathroom is large. Our room was furnished with dark green wall paper which make the room looked even smaller. After few hours I got used to it. There is a fridge, TV with only one English speaking channel, closet (seems to part of the wall). One thing they don't have is tea/coffee making facilities which was quite important to us (but also seems common in Venice). Not much power outlet either as we needed them for laptop, phone charger, camera battery charger all at once. Another thing, they do have a wifi connection access but you have to pay EU6 for an hour or EU12 for cumulative 20 hours. The service is actually provided by a local telco instead of the hotel. We took the 20 hours connection and the connection was very good. Although they said we can use the connection on our 3G phone throughout Venice, actually that only applies for hotspots which we can hardly remember where. Breakfast was nice the first day as we got homemade bread and croissant (we came from rice eating region) and homemade hot cocoa. They also have cereal, biscuits, cheese, ham, fruit. But after 3 days of the same thing may not be inviting anymore. With all the downsides we did not regret staying there because there is a small halal kebab store just right at the corner which we frequent esp for dinner. The other halal kebab is far near Piazza Roma (20-40 mins away with vaporetto) They also sells pizza but the meaty ones are not halal. They say they will have the halal ones probably next year. Also we were glad to stay away from hotels near the canal as there was aqua alta (flood) when we were there. The location is also very near to everywhere important esp St. Marco and you can get almost all vaporetto route at the nearest vaporetto stop (San Marco)

Reviews.Title: “Well situated.”
Reviews.Author: Anikabella
Reviews.Content: Location: Located near St.Mark's basilica, this hotel is well situated. You can pretty much walk everywhere. It is a little hard to find as the streets in Venise aren't very straight and even with a map it's hard to find. We did find it without getting too lost. Lots of restaurants around the hotel. Boat-stop within three minute walk from the hotel. Check-in/Check-out/Staff: Took only a few minutes for both. The only weird thing about this hotel is that they make you leave your keys at the reception desk whenever you leave. Most staff could speak both French and English which was usefull. Room: We had a triple room on the third floor, with a few on a brick wall. (so no view). We also had AC and a nice renovated bathroom. Shower pressure was good and the beds were comfortable. Very quiet. mini-bar in the room as well as a nice flat-screen TV. Breakfast: Good breakfast with warm buns and croissants, cereal, cheese, some cold-meats, juices and coffee. All included in the price of the Room. Overall: we paid about 115 Euros a night for a triple room. I would return. It's not big and not fancy... but the location was excellent, the staff was good and it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable Hotel, recommended”
Reviews.Author: Sardim
Reviews.Content: Very sweet small Hotel, has small rooms but room is very clean and has all you need including a modern ensuite bathroom. Helpful staff and good breakfast. Hotel very close to San Marco square. Upon arriving to Venice we didn't know exactly where the Hotel was but upon contacting the reception they explaned us its location and we soon found it.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel in a great location@”
Reviews.Author: ItalyGirl42
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Castello was a wonderful place to base our stay in Venice! It is a very short walk from the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop, and literally one block from St. Mark's Square. Our room was small but lovely and immaculately clean, and the breakfast buffet was ample and varied. The decor was evocative of Renaissance and Baroque Venice, with brocade, damask, and velvet furnishings, and Murano chandeliers and sconces. I especially enjoyed the charming paintings by the father of Fabio, the manager. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the cost was very reasonable! I shall book all furure stays in Venice at the Hotel Castello!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel; excellent location”
Reviews.Author: love_to_travel_2113
Reviews.Content: After spending hours looking for a budget hotel in Venice, I found Hotel Castello by doing a random search of hotels near St. Mark's Square using Google maps. We had 3 couples in our party and booked a double and a quad. The double was adequate -- typical of what you will find in most cities in Italy (translation = small); but it was equal to or better than the other 3 hotels we stayed in during our trip. The quad was a bit too small for four. It was really a triple (double and single bed) with a cot thrown in. But for two nights, we were very happy with our stay. The air conditioning was included in the rate (we had to pay a surcharge everywhere else); and the breakfast was very good, adding significantly to the value of the room. The staff was excellent; very nice, very accommodating. We would stay here again, because the location is awesome with great restaurants very close by. The price of hotels can be very expensive in Venice especially the closer you get to St. Mark's. This was a great find.

Reviews.Title: “How to find it when we go back”
Reviews.Author: DumbledoreKent
Reviews.Content: Amazing to read such varied revues - yes it was hard to find, but talking to other travellers it seems like every hotel in Venice is too. We arrived by boat from the airport in front of the Monument (monumento), all the taxi and bus services seem to have piers there. Turning left took us over our first bridge and then we turned right up Calle delle Rasse. A left turn at the top brought us out into the square (Campo SS Filippo e Giacomo) by a pharmacy (most of the "squares" in Venice are neither square nor rectangular). This Pharmacy is at the bottom right of the square and you need to leave by the top right exit. Looking up at the wall in front of you will see "Hotel Rio" sign. The Castello is effectively behind this one. So walk up that alley, which has a glass fronted bar on the left under the Hotel Rio. After just a few yards turn left in the first alley and it is on your left. If you pass the grocery shop and the Hotel "Bridge" - you have missed it. Most of Venice has a smell, but it was not overpowering during our visit. The staff were very good and we had asked for a room on the first floor. We didn't expect it to be huge, and it was fine. The bathroom had a big shower, sink, bidet and WC. We only took one wheeled case and small backpacks, as we knew what to expect with getting about in Venice. If we were on a world tour with big cases each then the space might have felt a bit tight perhaps. We don't expect "full English/American " breakfasts when we are in Europe and we had no complaints. There was a choice of about 3 juices, Croissant and rolls on the table, much Yoghurt and cake, along with choices galore of teas and honey/jam and fresh cofee served on request with hot water for tea making. We were a bit late starting on our first morning and nobody came to clear us away at the end. Based on what we saw we would return and recommend

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travellingthegl0be
Reviews.Content: we had extreme difficulty finding place as sign light not working and we arrived at night. terrible sewerage smell on entry. No lift so lugged bags up several flights. We were a group of 4 women. 2 got a decent room. 2 of us got room the worst i have been in ever, I could touch roof. Heavy timber beams. Scraped fingers taking top off. I am 157cm or 5 foot 1 tall!!! Room measured 3m x 3 1/2 m including bathroom. Very stuffy and hot. Couldn't get heater off. Floor and ceiling slanted and so did matresses. Needed window open but invaded by mosquitos. Complained the next morning and got brushoff that that wa venice what did we expect. Fortunately we got a better room second night. 2 other couples similar complaint. Seems there are several rooms which belong to an annex building which are very bad. Wonder if they try what they think they can get away with and if you don't put up a fuss you get the dog room!!! or unless you know there aree better rooms!! Beakfast was poor quality and meagre selection. Proximity to San Marco does not outweigh dodgy tactics and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster”
Reviews.Author: Aussie143
Reviews.Content: Hotel hard to find and is in a dingy back alley. Foyer smelled horrible and the room was aweful. Beds were worn and uncomfortable and room was hot with the window opening onto the garbage collection terrace (people could climb into your room). Requested another room which was better but still not very nice. Breakfast was unimpressive. Would not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all a recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: polo_traveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a small moisty street that seems never to be seen by the sun. It smelled awful because of the moist and the perfume they used to cover the smell. The rooms are very small, couldn't even open our luggage and be able to walk in the room. The rooms overlook the opposite building which is in 1 meter distance. Don't trust the pictures you see in the site. Overall a bad choice, it spoiled our night there.

Reviews.Title: “Budget convenience for Venice with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Methusala
Reviews.Content: Very well situated near P. S. Marco. Comfortable rooms up very steep stairs. Staff welcoming and take an interest.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: stepsrus
Reviews.Content: The hotel appears to be in the process of renovating-apparently starting with bottom floors. The common areas and stairways are well worn but clean & welcoming. I found the staff helpful in some areas. We were in a room on the third floor- no lift however staff assisted with bags. Unfortunately as you rose each flight so did the temperature. Our room was stifling until around 04:00 am when the struggling air-con finally overcame the heat. Our room was a reasonable size but the fabric covered walls were quite shabby. The bathroom was tiny, grotty and needed to be left for 30mins after each shower to allow the three inches of water to drain from the floor (overflow from shower recess). We advised management of this and the only response was that they were already aware.We travelled with our preteen & friends who have teenage children. Our friends stayed on a lower floor & it appeared their room had been recently revamped. Lovely new bathroom with massaging jets and a bath. My suggestion is to be specific about which room you would like to book-unfortunately I cannot recall room numbers.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: shazzy1161
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the begining of July for our Wedding Anniversary. I picked the Hotel from the airmiles website. I chose it for its proximity to St Marks. We arrived in Venice on Jet2 from Leeds and walked down to catch the Water bus we got off at the stop before St Marks square as suggested on the hotel info and had no problems finding the hotel even though it is tucked away down a narrow street. I think our room was number 5. It was just at the top of the stairs overlooking the entrance. The room was small with twin beds pushed together to form a double bed (as is standard in most european hotels) we had a small built in wardrobe, dressing table with mini bar bedside table either side of the bed and a chair. As we weren't planning on spending a lot of time in the room, size was of no consequence,the room was big enough and pleasant enough. I was very pleased with the ensuite which appeared to be quite new. Lovely walk in shower toilet/bidet and a hairdryer by the washbasin. The decor of our room was dark blue the walls were fabric covered which I really liked. You cant expect 21st century decor in a 17th century building. The air conditioning was great for my husband too cool for me but we found a happy medium. We only had breakfast in the hotel which was a standard continental and quite adequate, plenty of coffee, and nothing seemed to be too much trouble for the staff.(a family staying at the same time as us asked for their croissants to be warmed) We didn't make use of the bar facilities or the mini bar so I can't comment on them. We are in our late forties and spend a lot of time out and about we chose the hotel for it's central location and weren't disappointed. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, cramped rooms, simply put, terrible.”
Reviews.Author: honestyisurfriend
Reviews.Content: I can start by saying that this hotel is dirty, no air conditioning in the common areas except the lounge downstairs, which even then is on low setting. The carpets are filthy, the decor is atrocious and the rooms are overpriced and way too small. Don't bother getting a room for 4, they should all be for 2 people max. They provide you with a fold out old school bed, I don't think a double bed exists in this hotel and the beds are uncomfortable. I stayed in 2 different rooms and they both had dysfunctional air conditioners. 1 bathroom was in poor shape, 1 in good shape, and 1 didn't have shower. 1 room smelled unbelievably strong of urine. When we got their the smell was masked with about 3 ounces of perfume, but after that faded, it was intolerable. We couldn't sleep at all and felt sick for most of our stay. The service for the most part was awful. They claim 24hr service, but the night clerk sleeps during his shift at the tables in the common lounge. Not only that, but he gives you a hard time if you want to go out after about 10 pm because it is cutting into his nap time. They don't appear to care about you, only about your money, and don't make much of an effort after you're booked. We could not get access to internet at all, because none of the staff had any idea how to obtain it (they said it was offered by a third party). There is no elevator for your luggage, however the staff are kind enough to bring some up for you.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortably small room”
Reviews.Author: cbn218
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 6-night stay at the Hotel Castello and while the location was very good (being right behind St. Mak's Square) I was very disappointed. The room was clean but, unfortunately, that's the only good thing I can say about it - it was uncomfortably tiny and cramped and the decor was shabby and dated. I would not recommend this hotel. For the money - you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable visit”
Reviews.Author: gsharp2
Reviews.Content: Thank you very much, although the hotel was tucked away in a side street off a square, it turned out to be a hidden gem. Ideal for doing Venice, so close to St. Mark's Square. The staff and management of the hotel were wonderful, polite and helpful, whilst the hotel may have been outshone by grander establishments, it proved ideal for our five-day stay and went a long way to a memorable stay in Venice. The hotel was clean and the little wear on the stair carpets proved how well used the establishment was, the bathroom was far superior to that offered in other establishments we have visited both abroad and in the UK. Thank you Hotel Castello, you went a long way to making our trip to Venice a holiday of a lifetime!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Eurotripers
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the hotest of days. We found it well as we did a google map search. Close to Grand Canal,sights and shops all on foot. From the dashing gentlemen at the front desk to the charming West Indian who was a great fan of our Aussie cricket team and the lovely breakfast lady with a never ending smile, all were very relaxed and welcoming. The hotel was well equipt and we found it very clean and quiet surprisingly as how close it is to the passing alley traffic. The aircon worked very well considering the heat and our mini fridge managed OK . Our family of four enjoyed our morning breakfast ritual and was so relaxed whilst taking in the typical venitian fittings. The coffee was the best ( and we have done the coffee rounds in Italy). My Kids looked forward to the Hot chocolate every morning even in the excessive heat We stayed all of 6 days and enjoyed each one at this hotel.. Belfield, Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jaymiller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked on the spur of the moment for our wedding anniversary. I then read the Trip Advisor reviews and was a little concerned at what we might find. Why were people making such a fuss? It's position is great, the rooms are clean and well presented, breakfast was fine and we found the staff to be polite and friendly. We were on the third floor but the lack of lift just helped us to burn up the calories from the Italian food and wine. We recommend La Neova Perla resteraunt on the corner of the Via Garibaldi and there is a nice little cafe just round the corner from the pharmacy on the corner of the square - the toasted sandwiches are a must! The only drawback we found were the pigeons who were awake a lot earlier than we would have liked. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Hotel Castello”
Reviews.Author: mbechard
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed two nights at Hotel Castello. The hotel was well located, and the room was comfortable, though a bit small by American standards. The bathroom was a delight. The hotel doesn't have a lift, and our room was on the third floor, so that was a bit challenging each day. Booking through Expedia, we got an excellent price, especially considering how expensive Venice is in comparison to other Italian cities. The staff was usually helpful, and breakfast was very adequate. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: newboyParis
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for 3 nights. Very average hotel, service not good and overall not impressive. Rooms average, bathrooms tiny and the hotel is overpriced. The only good thing was breakfast. Would not recommend this hotel and there are better options available. There is a restaurant very close by (round the corner and in the centre of the square) called 'Acuigheta' or something similar. The waiter (with grey hair and looks like Steven Spielberg) very rude and arrogant. The only time he attended us was to explain the specials of the day, when we didnt want them he explained in a loud voice, 'why you dont take my recommendations. The next time we saw him was when he gave us the bill and he whispered "tips have not been included yet'. My wife didnt get any thank you when we departed. The food was overpriced, poor service and would not recommend this restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Building work!”
Reviews.Author: BelleWiltshire
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from this very well located Hotel having stayed for 3 nights. My room was comfortable but the window looked out on to a wall which was 3 feet away and at the end of a long gap of two walls, so no light! However,it was quiet, that is.......... until yesterday morning at 7.50am when I was woken by incredibly loud hammering and banging immediately above my room accompanied by drilling. I rang the reception, to say that I thought my ceiling was about to fall in, who made no apology and just said "the workmen start at 8 am". It was impossible to stay in the room at this point , it really sounded like they were knocking down walls, and I feel I should have been warned at least beforehand about this, or, perhaps the workmen should at least have started at 9am? Thankfully they do not work at the weekend. They are apparently, refurbishing rooms and the noise vibrates throughout the whole Hotel. I only found this out by going to look for myself! I do feel that the Management have a duty to the guests and prospective guests to warn them about these intrusive/noisy works. This is all very unfortunate as the Hotel is not a bad place, the breakfast was decent enough and the breakfast room quite smart. I did feel, though, that the Management/reception staff just did not care.

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic!”
Reviews.Author: Tiers07
Reviews.Content: This was a surpise trip for my birthday so I had no input in the planning at all. It was fab! Very romantic little hotel - very traditional. It was only 5 mins walk to St.Marks square so great location. There is a bar and pizzeria near by so no problem to get food as soon as you arrive. It was that good my dad took my mom to the same hotel.
